container.heading: Maryland Medicaid Managed Care Program: Sanctions

para.text: If the Department determines, after a sufficient investigation, that an MCO or any agent or employee of the MCO, or any person with an ownership interest in an MCO, or related party of the MCO, has failed to comply with any applicable law, regulation, or contract term, or for other good cause shown, the Department may impose sanctions on the MCO, including but not limited to:
Fines;
Suspension of further enrollment;
Withholding all or part of the capitation payment;
Termination of the current HealthChoice Managed Care Organization Agreement;
Disqualification from future participation in the Maryland Medicaid Managed Care Program;
Orders to provide a benefit or service to enrollees; and
Those outlined in 42 CFR §§438.700—438.708, as amended.
Corrective Action.

Subject to §B(2) of this regulation, before imposing a sanction pursuant to §A of this regulation, the Department may permit an MCO an opportunity to take corrective action in accordance with a plan approved by the Department.
The MCO shall submit a corrective action plan within a time frame specified by the Department.

section.heading: Sanction by Center for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS).
section.text: The Department shall comply with notification requirements of CMS at 42 CFR §438.730 for sanction determinations as specified in 42 CFR §438.700(b)(1)—(b)(6).

para.text: From the decisions set forth in §B(1)—(8) of this regulation, an MCO may exercise the appeal rights set forth in §C of this regulation.
The following Department decisions are appealable by the MCO or MCO applicant:
Denial of an entity’s completed application to become an MCO;
Decision to terminate the MCO's participation in the Maryland Medicaid Managed Care Program;
Decision to impose a fine valued at $50,000 or more on the MCO as described in Regulation .01 of this chapter;
Order that the MCO is impaired or in “hazardous financial condition”;
An adverse decision by the IRO as described in COMAR 10.67.13.08;
The denial of a hepatitis C payment as described in COMAR 10.67.04.19;
Overpayments recovered by the Department as described in COMAR 10.67.07.01; and
Remittances to the Department as described in COMAR 10.67.04.19-5.
An MCO may appeal a decision listed in §B of this regulation to the Office of Administrative Hearings as specified in COMAR 10.01.03 and COMAR 10.09.36.09.
The parties to an appeal to the Office of Administrative Hearings under §C of this regulation are the Department and the MCO. The enrollee is not a party at this hearing.
The following sanctions shall take effect immediately and are not subject to stay during the pendency of an appeal:
Any fines imposed;
Any full or partial withhold of the capitation payment;
Any remittances to the Department as described in COMAR 10.67.04.19-5; or
Any overpayments recovered by the Department as described in COMAR 10.67.07.01.
All monies collected from the MCOs as a result of the imposition of a financial sanction shall be deposited in the HealthChoice Performance Incentive Fund.
This nonlapsing fund shall include all sanctions imposed on the MCOs starting in calendar year 1999.
The fund shall be used to provide financial incentive awards to the MCOs that meet or exceed specific performance targets as established by the Department, unless otherwise directed by law.
